StreetPass is a cool new browser extension that uses Mastodon's verification system in a clever way.

Mastodon users verify themselves by adding a custom link to their personal site. StreetPass lets you know when you've found one of these links, and adds them to your list. As you browse the web, StreetPass will build a list of Mastodon users that belong to the websites you visit.

I spoke with the creater @tvler about the project, 🧵 below.

Chapter SIX of my book tells the story of light-level geolocators! These teeny-tiny devices calculate & record a bird's approximate location using only a light sensor, a clock, a memory chip, & a miniature battery. First invented by a penguin researcher, they're now used to track the migrations of tiny songbirds such as warblers. The only catch is that researchers have to recapture the bird & retrieve the device to download the data! https://bookshop.org/p/books/flight-paths-how-a-passionate-and-quirky-group-of-pioneering-scientists-solved-the-mystery-of-bird-migration-rebecca-heisman/18815100 #books #bookstodon #birds #science

title: Rachel Thomas, PhD - I was an AI researcher. Now, I am an immunology student.

last_post.content:
After over a decade working as a data scientist and AI researcher, I have gone back to school for a Masters in Immunology. When I become fascinated by a topic, I want to learn as much as I can.

My ultimate goal is to apply my machine learning & data ethics skills to immunology, but I want to make sure I fully understand the underlying domain & relevant context first. With ML, it’s important to not just be a hammer searching for a nail.

What is the greatest unknown, if not the universe itself? It seemed natural, therefore, to chose an image of the universe as the source for the new video of "Unknow", a piece for piano, bass, contrabass, electronic drums, and oud, dedicated to the homonym character by Magnus (Roberto Raviola). You can freely download the song in lossless format from https://eidon.bandcamp.com/track/unknow

"Unknow" is one of my "imaginary soundtracks" -- soundtracks for movies, or cartoons, which actually... do not exist (yet). Here I try to represent the strain of a life in perennial flight from the perils of the present and the horror of the past. The "fugato" in the piece corresponds to this flight -- this fugue state, if you allow me the pun.

If you like this piece, follow me on Bandcamp: https://eidon.bandcamp.com/follow_me on youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZ0UIBDZEYlvn8thxv3aOxw, and FB, https://www.facebook.com/EidonVeda.

Video is a zoom out of "Tapestry of Blazing Starbirth" (https://esahubble.org/images/heic2007a/), a NASA/ESA/Hubble picture. Credit: NASA, ESA, and STScI. License: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/
The video consists of portions of the original image, scaled down to a frame size of 900x618 pixels.

The video was created with veemadge (https://gitlab.com/Eidonko/veemadge). It can be watche also on #youtube: https://youtu.be/Bq0nEhlJoME.

The music is by and (c) Eidon (Eidon at tutanota.com, Eidon.Songs at gmail.com). All rights reserved.

What is the greatest unknown, if not the universe itself? It seemed natural, therefore, to chose an image of the universe as the source for the new video of "Unknow", a piece for piano, bass, contrabass, electronic drums, and oud, dedicated to the homonym character by Magnus (Roberto Raviola). You can freely download the song in lossless format from https://eidon.bandcamp.com/track/unknow

"Unknow" is one of my "imaginary soundtracks" -- soundtracks for movies, or cartoons, which actually... do not exist (yet). Here I try to represent the strain of a life in perennial flight from the perils of the present and the horror of the past. The "fugato" in the piece corresponds to this flight -- this fugue state, if you allow me the pun.

title: Grandala: Identification & Photos - Shanghai Birding 上海观鸟

last_post.content:
The Grandala breeds on barren, wind-swept slopes above scrub line. Often in large flocks, it feeds on invertebrates and berries on the ground. The male is unmistakable, with shimmering cobalt blue plumage; the female is grey-brown with white streaking and a blue tinge to rump and tail coverts. Range: across the Himalayas to the Tibetan Plateau in China. Call: a piercing, melodious tiyoo.
—Craig Brelsford

title: Who Counts? Ghanaian Academic Publishing and Global Science – African Minds

last_post.content:
'This book goes beyond the numbers. It tells the story of how the Ghanaian academy is being transformed by this bibliometric economy. It offers a rich account of the voices and perspectives of Ghanaian academics and African journal publishers. How, where and when are Ghana’s researchers disseminating their work, and what do these experiences reveal about an unequal global science system? Is there pressure to publish in ‘reputable’ international journals, what role do supervisors, collaborators and mentors play, and how do academics manage in conditions of scarcity?'

'Who Counts? Ghanaian Academic Publishing and Global Science' by David Mills, Patricia Kingori, Abigail Branford, Samuel T. Chatio, Natasha Robinson and Paulina Tindana

#openaccess

https://www.africanminds.co.za/who-counts/

title: R Geomatic - New release of cartography

last_post.content:
New version of {cartography} :rstats: package.

Blog post here:
https://rcarto.github.io/posts/cartography_v3.1.3/

This release has been triggered by the upcoming retirement of {rgeos} and {rgdal} (see https://r-spatial.org/r/2022/04/12/evolution.html).

Key message for {cartography} users:
1. Switch from {cartography} to {mapsf} if possible => https://riatelab.github.io/mapsf
2. Use {maptiles} instead of getTiles() => https://github.com/riatelab/maptiles
3. Use {potential} instead of smoothLayer() => https://riatelab.github.io/potential

title: Library on Wheels: Mary Lemist Titcomb and America's First Bookmobile eBook : Glenn, Sharlee: Amazon.com.au: Kindle Store

last_post.content:
Born in 1852, Mary Titcomb had a strong desire for an education & career.

Mary became a librarian & making #books accessible to everyone was a priority. She came up with a children’s room & set up “book stations” in shops & post offices in town.

But Mary noticed people from rural areas weren’t visiting the #library. So, she secured funding to build & begin the nation’s first bookmobile. 📚

https://www.amazon.com.au/Library-Wheels-Titcomb-Americas-Bookmobile-ebook/dp/B078W6SQZQ #history
